pros: Great colleagues and commitment to equity. Organization works hard to help students and believes in creating a friendly and equitable work environment. Depending on department there's accommodation to WFH. Work/life balance is supported and a big selling point.
cons: Unfortunately working in academia means lower compensation than the industry standard. Union support is strong and benefits/compensation have increased gradually thanks to their work.

review_title: This is where careers go to die
pros: Great commute from Mukilteo -- but I would rather work for larger schools like UW and Bellevue College as they have a better dept structure and funding -- this school is rinky
cons: Everything else -- staff, students, all of it are a one way ticket to burn out central -- found something much better

pros: 40 hour work week and very good medical, dental and vision insurance.
cons: Hard to move up. Government fund accounting. Union represented. No additional pay or bonus for outperformance.

review_title: Great students and faculty; instability in leadership
pros: The faculty are top notch and great to work with. Collaboration between academic programs, sharing of ideas, and mentoring is superb. Lower level management (Deans) are supportive and give full range of academic freedom.
cons: Upper level management has been unstable, volatile, and unpredictable. This has forced many mid-level administration out and a general sense of instability among employees.

review_title: Good PT job with inconsistent leadership
pros: The students. Workshops from teaching learning center. Strong faculty union. Caring front line staff. A newish, modern facing, president (good improvement from predecessor)
cons: Last minute, cancelled class offerings and schedule changes. An out of touch Board of Trustees who want to hear positives and avoid addressing negatives in public or constructively. Admin that request input when an end game has been determined. Don’t waste people’s time.

pros: Friendly, kind, nice, reliable, workplace.
cons: no any cons are existed. It was good experience.

pros: Second paycheck is Awesome. My work has a direct effect on peoples lives!
cons: Administration wants everything for nothing. Constantly hounding you to do work that is outside the scope of your contract with no compensation. Trying every trick in the book to deflect from that fact and make you feel like your not doing your job!

pros:
Great coworkers, dedicated to the mission of changing lives through education.
They're not there for the money.
cons: Money would be nice, though.

review_title: Fine college in a broken system
job_title: Adjunct Faculty Member in Seattle, WA
pros: Colleagues care about colleagues and about students
cons: System itself devalues instructors, particularly adjuncts, and student success isn't really rewarded (this is universal across higher ed in my experience)

pros: Pretty good and friendly and fun
cons: only allowed part time for students

pros: Have always had wonderful and supportive coworkers and supervisors.
cons: Currently going through challenges budget wise because of Covid.

review_title: Great place to work as a student
pros: Great pay for a student and a great learning experience.
cons: There are no cons. It was a great experience.

pros: Great working environment with friendly coworkers
cons: Sometimes might require extra work

review_title: Close and be part of a growing community of business and education
job_title: Information Technology Specialist in Everett, WA
pros:
One reason I believe to work at Everett Community College is the distance from local businesses and growing suburban development. I do not need to travel from up north down to Redmond, Seattle, or Bellevue for a decent Information Technology job. With the rising gas prices, this is a big factor. We also feature right next to the college transit station, including connections to the Everett Train Station.

Also, the communities and businesses around Everett continue growing, including more and more job openings. This gives more options to the employee where we can work more with our employer. Small businesses also make up much of the region, allowing for better client relationships helping each other grow. Job Security seems to be better then private industry.
cons:
Downsides to working at the college and as a government worker, a political process is always part of the job, so priorities and scope of projects change frequently. Our salary is also on the low end of IT jobs compared to private industry, and our benefits may also not be the same as other companies. However the industry continues to change.

The college is sometimes considered lower standards compared to other high prestigious colleges or universities. However I think we make it up by providing low income or first time college students the chance to start their education and move towards a long term goals and careers.

pros: Teaching students is the best part.
cons: Hours are varied each quarter.

job_title: Director of Public Relations in Everett, WA
pros: Important mission, valuable work supporting students.
cons: Decreasing state funding in the past decade.

pros: Students at this school are wonderful. Many are struggling financially and being able to help them achieve their educational goals is incredible. Most coworkers and the instructors are great.  I love my job and my department.
cons: Typical to pubic colleges, management takes inordinate amounts of time to approve even the littlest thing. Be aware that financial aid department is rated one of the worst in the state so be prepared for a lot of avocation and frustration if your position works closely with them.  On campus books store is owned by B&N and does not have students best interest in mind and most employees are rude to both staff and students, since they are not accountable to the school. They keep going through new management so that may change.  Depending on your department, they are very tight pocketed with their initial salaries.  They are behind the curve when it comes to technology. The information offered online is 2005 technology at best.

pros: Connecting with diverse audience on campus.
cons: Not that many hours for work.

pros: Health insurance. Weekend off...Nothing much
cons: You would mostly do all of the work for the whole office.

pros: EvCC is a typical state employer. The union is great here, they are quick to act and support their members. Most of the instructors are good at what they do and truly care about students. With the addition of new buildings over the past several years, the campus now has a modern, up-to-date feel to it. Parking has gotten better from 10 years ago and the cafeteria improved with new management.
cons: There is an underlying sense of secrecy and gossip going on. Administration is often duplicitous in their conversations with faculty and staff. Egos rule the show in many departments and the Deans are in the unenviable position of dealing with tenured, unionized faculty. Support staff are sometimes lazy and incompetent and all too often this is overlooked by administrators. Watch out for the back stabbers.. you never know where they are lurking

pros: Friendly people who are passionate about serving students. Positive environment and a beautiful campus. Good work life balance. Strong emphasis on supporting and encouraging diversity.
cons: Pay is extremely low (particularly if you aren't a tenured instructor or an administrator) and resources are very limited. Limited opportunities for upward movement. I only recommend this work if you are truly passionate about working in higher education and okay with a very meager salary.

review_title: Great colleagues and a supportive administration make this school a rewarding place to teach.
pros: Administration is committed to innovation in teaching. Faculty are competent and really care about the students. Students come from a community that values sustainability, family and hard work.
cons: As is true of any community college, the compensation is not enough.

pros: The people I worked with in the department and the administration were helpful.  The classroom was well-equipped, and the computers were arranged in a way that was conducive for group work.
cons: The cons are the same as teaching for most any community college - unless you're in a high-demand subject (like math or English), your course load can be unpredictable.  Also FT positions are few and far-between.

pros: Union takes care of their people. The building where my office is located is very nice and up to date for student and  faculty. New president is enthusiastic.
cons: Very difficult, if not completely impossible to have issues addressed. I endured a hostile co-worker for two years with zero administrative answer to my pleas for help.

review_title: Toxic bureaucracy shows contempt for students and faculty.
pros: Instructors and Deans really care about their work.
cons: The career bureaucrats who run the administrative departments (registration, financial aid, and especially IT) show a toxic degree of contempt for students and instructors and are constantly undermining the good work of the organization.

pros: Evcc is a good place to work at they provide you with all the materials and resource to be successful at  your job. Good benefit and pays very well.
cons: it looks like they are some people in there who do not know what they are doing. always getting things  mixed up.

pros: I got a chance to work on my welding skills at the same time help other with welding at the same time.
cons: there want any cons to this job at all.

pros: Great people that teach you along the way. I totally enjoyed how well I was treated as I was a student.
cons: My work study position didn't last long enough. I would have liked to have learned even more than I was able to in a short time.

job_title: Mechanical Maintenance II in Everett, WA
pros: Awesome community support. Folks tend to get along really well! With the new President Daria Willis I have a very positive attitude.
cons: Occasionally you get an individual into a position that is challenged. That’s the case anywhere.

pros: Majority of colleagues are in it for the right reason, for student success! Also, there have been a lot of turnover in recent years, and I would say for the better.
cons: Lots of turnover and inconsistent strategic planning

pros: Very friendly.  Very diverse culture on campus.  Flexible hours for a college student.  Understanding to a student's needs when class comes before work.
cons: Low pay but the pros make up for it.

pros: Generally speaking, people are nice.
cons: Sometimes a dedicated worker like me get upset because some people working here get paid for doing nothing. I'm serious.

pros: As a state employee you enjoy great benefits.
cons: It can be political and the salaries aren't great.

pros: Family-like environment, co-workers are very friendly and very helpful. the students also very friendly. its a great place to grow.
